required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Success of Labor Induction Based on a Modified BISHOP Score.
clinical_study.official_title: The Success of Labor Induction Based on a Modified BISHOP Score Compared to Classic BISHOP Score and Cervical Length in Transvaginal Sonography.

brief_summary.textblock:
Pregnant women at term will be divided randomly into 3 groups:
1. Gynecological evaluation based on classic BISHOP score.
2. Gynecological evaluation based on a modified BISHOP score.
3. Gynecological evaluation based on cervical length as measured by transvaginal sonography.
After gynecological evaluation, women will undergo induction of labor based on obstetric evaluation according to the group they were part of.

detailed_description.textblock:
Women presenting to the obstetric emergency room for follow-up for various obstetric/other medical conditions over 37 weeks` gestation that are candidates for labor induction will receive an explanation regarding the study and sign informed consent.
The women will be divided randomly into 3 groups:
1. Gynecological evaluation based on classic BISHOP score.
2. Gynecological evaluation based on a modified BISHOP score.
3. Gynecological evaluation based on cervical length as measured by transvaginal sonography.
After gynecological evaluation, women will undergo induction of labor based on obstetric evaluation according to the group they were part of.

primary_outcome.description: The time from induction commencement to delivery of the newborn.

secondary_outcome.description: BISHOP score after primary induction. BISHOP is not an abbreviation and is just the name of the score. The minimum score is 0 and the maximum score is 13. The higher the score, the more favorable the cervix is considered before induction of labor.

clinical_study.condition: Induction of Labor Affected Fetus / Newborn

arm_group.description: Gynecological evaluation based on vaginal examination including cervical dilatation, effacement, texture, station and position.
Gynecological evaluation based on vaginal examination including cervical dilatation and effacement alone.
Gynecological evaluation based on cervical length measured by transvaginal sonography.

intervention.description: Cervical properties as evaluated by a vaginal examination.
Cervical length as evaluated by a transvaginal sonography.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women over 37 weeks` gestation that are candidates for induction of labor for obstetric/other medical indications.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancies.
- Candidates for vaginal delivery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancies.
- Candidates for cesarean section.
